text: I confess that sometimes I to experience
doubt I've been to too many of these
things I've seen too many families go
through this
now I'm not naive I have spoken at too
many memorials during the course of this
presidency am a z33 I've hugged too many
families who've lost loved to senseless
minds and I've seen how a spirit of
unity born of tragedy can gradually
dissipated overtaken by the return to
business as usual
by inertia and old habits and expediency
I see how easily we slip back into our
old notions because they're comfortable
we're used to I've seen how inadequate
words can be in bringing about lasting
change I've seen how how inadequate my
own words have been it's hard not to
think sometimes that the center won't
hold but Dallas I'm here to say we must
reject such despair
